titles.title: Asbestos Information Act of 1988
Asbestos Information Act of 1988
A bill to provide the Environmental Protection Agency and the public with additional information about asbestos products.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1117.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/3/1988--Introduced. Asbestos Information Act of 1988 - Requires that those who manufacture or process asbestos or asbestos-containing material report to the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, within 90 days after this Act's enactment, on the years of manufacture, the types or classes of product, and other identifying characteristics reasonably necessary to identify or distinguish such material. Requires the Administrator to publish such information within 180 days after this Act's enactment.
